com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable

Interface Observer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.EventListener
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConfigMonitor, DebugMonitor, FileOrCLIMonitor, FittestMonitor, Monitor, OverviewMonitor, Population, SelectiveMonitor, SimplePopulation

    public interface Observer
extends java.util.EventListener
    Simple implementation of the Observer part of the Observer pattern.
    Author:
    O. J. Coleman
    See Also:
    Observable

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void eventOccurred(Observable observed, java.lang.Object event, java.lang.Object state)
      Called when the subject being observed triggers an event (generally when it has changed state in a significant way).

    • Method Detail

      • eventOccurred

        void eventOccurred(Observable observed,
                 java.lang.Object event,
                 java.lang.Object state)
        Called when the subject being observed triggers an event (generally when it has changed state in a significant way).
        Parameters:
        observed - The subject (the object being observed).
        event - An object indicating the type of change or event, this is usually an defined by the Subject. If null is given then the Observer(s) will be passed Observable.Event.Unspecified.
        state - An arbitrary object typically describing the current state of the Observable or information about the event.
